data.title: Breakfast food all day
data.text: Small and charming restaurant.  They have an interesting menu, I was able to get a breakfast combo that came with fish instead of traditional breakfast meat.  It was tasty and the portions are huge!  I didn't have lunch, but the person I was with raved about the hotdogs!

data.title: So good!
data.text: What a yummy place! I liked the friendly staff who greeted us as we came in. The food was great and we all had a fun lunch together. The atmosphere was also nice.

data.title: Great atmosphere and breakfasts
data.text: This place could be called a dive place. We have only had breakfasts here but they are very reasonable and good.

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: The decor is fun and service was friendly but slow.  Food was nothing special or memorable.  Cheese on my omelet was the fake process crap.

data.title: oldest restaurant in duluth
data.text: Fun décor on the walls/ceiling including the prices from waaay back when burgers and malts were far less in price.  Found out it is the oldest continuously running restaurant in Duluth.  older than Fitgers simply because it never stopped running business. great for kids, adults and anyone who likes simple food with good environment!

data.title: Best Food in Town
data.text:
I will go out of my way to stop in for one last meal in Duluth.

Great food and friendly staff.  

You will not find a better gyro anywhere.  Obviously the Coney's are good, too.  Pibb on tap!

The decor has not changed much over the years (decades).  But that's all right!  At least the place is clean!

I will keep coming back forever.

data.title: Delicious Breakfast Stop
data.text:
We stopped for breakfast and the server was very friendly and made us feel right at home even though we was busy.
The breakfast sandwich on a pretzel bun that I had was delicious and exactly what I wanted.  My coworker agreed that her omelette was very good.
There appeared to be limited seating and I can imagine that on a weekend the place is very busy and packed.

data.title: Great Coney Islands
data.text: This place (First Street location) is a Duluth institution and has been serving the same great Coney Islands for over 50 years. They are the best Coney Islands I've had in the state of MN. If you like Coney Islands or Gyros give them a try.

data.title: The coneys never disappoint!
data.text: We only come here for one thing and one thing only. The coneys. They're terrific, just the right amount of minced onion, mustard, soft bun, hot dog that pops when you bite into it.  Two coneys wrapped together in paper. You can't eat just one! Classic. Simple. Delicious. We don't go for the ambiance, or location. We go for the coneys. And they are perfect. We typically get them to go--though it's hard to get home without eating one!

data.title: Average
data.text: My wife and I heard a lot about this place so we decided to stop in.  I do understand that this is a really old and historic reaturant but it did not appeal to our eyes and ears.  The place was very quite and wished there was a little music or TV.  There were a few lights burn out.  The place was hotter and more humid than outside.  The walls were filled with boats which, yes, that is what Duluth is all about but I was hoping to see more of an exciting theme.  The food was definitely talked up as it was just average but the price is hard to beat.  Most likely will not be going back.  Sorry

data.title: Great Coneys 1958 - today
data.text: Stopped for a coney on my return to Minneapolis, hadn't had the opportunity to indulge for the past few years, and was more than delighted that the dogs have remained the same since I was a Duluth boy who ate here at least weekly.  I will be back soon!  The coneys are the best I have had anywhere.....

data.title: Gyros too!
data.text: Guys like their coneys so... happily enough I discovered they have the best gyro in town. The people are friendly. It's clean. The soup is homemade and is a relatively healthy choice. Prices are reasonable. Ok. We can go there for lunch.

data.title: Much better than McKellar Confectionary in Thunder Bay, ON
data.text: Best Coneys in the Northland are here and the Deluxe Coney Island at the Miller Hill Mall do not bother going anywhere else

data.title: An old favorite
data.text: A Duluth landmark! I don't eat a lot of hot dogs, but this place is a flash from the past and still has the best Coney dog around, so when the urge hits, I head to one of there three locations in Duluth.

data.title: Great dogs
data.text: Found this place online and saw that it had great reviews. I made it there just before closing time on a Sunday night after a long drive. The employees were friendly and the food was hot and fresh.

data.title: Can't hold a candle to McKellar Confectionary in Thunder Bay, ON
data.text: I am a Coney sauce connoisseur and this place was average.  The place I mention in the title of my review is hands down the champion.  They do serve other food as well but I have only tried the Coney burger and dog.

data.title: Tasty dogs.
data.text: We have never had a coney Island style hot dog before today. Wow were they good. If you have never had a Coney Island dog before this is a great place for your first or even if you have had them before these are a must try.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: Perfect for the Coney lover.  We stop here whenever we are in Duluth.  The buns are are always fresh and warm, Coney sauce is delicious with the chopped onions slathered over the Coney dogs...with just a touch of mustard!  Neat atmosphere with the photos on the wall and the restaurant is very clean.

data.title: Classic coney dog revisited
data.text: I return here every visit to Duluth.  This time I was impressed with the cleanliness and the namesake product, the Coney Dog.  Everything was as good as you can get it if you are a Coney Dog freak.  The bun was steamed and fresh, the dog was tasty and snapped when bitten, the onions were uniformly diced and the coney sauce is the best anywhere.  Five star rating for a specialty sandwich the rest of the country could only hope to equal.

data.title: Consistent after 30+ years!
data.text: My husband is a Duluth native and I consider Duluth to be my adopted hometown.  My husband and good friend used to take the money they were paid from their paper routes and head down to treat themselves to a Coney.  We also consider a stop to for Coneys to be at the top of our list when we come home (we've even stopped for Coney's first on the way to family dinners!  My mother-in-law eventually found out :) )  The buns are always very soft and warm, the Coney sauce is delicious covered with chopped onions and those Coney dogs just pop when you take that first bite.  The decor hasn't changed in all these years and it just feels like home.  Our kids also make this a priority stop whenever they come to Duluth.  Ya gotta try these!  There are other food offerings here but we haven't tried anything else.
